original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The National Election Commission announced that the Local Government Election, which was due to be held on the 9th of March, has been postponed.
"The election was postponed due to reasons beyond the commission's control," the NEC said.
"A request has been made to the Speaker to intervene to obtain funds from the Treasury, which are necessary to conduct the election," the commission added.
Sri Lanka’s Elections Chief writes to Speaker to secure funds for LG Election
SLPP seek support to make Mahinda Rajapaksa Prime Minister – MP Channa Jayasumana
Saudi Arabia’s first ever women’s tennis team at Billie Jean Cup in Colombo
